channel.title: So i made a site

item.title: So i made a site
item.dc:creator: @TheAmmoBandit TheAmmoBandit
item.description:
@TheAmmoBandit wrote:

[quote=“m1lkman, post:34, topic:481785”][quote author=justaguy link=topic=600024.msg4222103#msg4222103 date=1360807028]

Loading everything at once is slow. If it’s a small enough site then I don’t see why not but for the OPs site that has a lot of graphics information it is a bad idea.

Well the browser will cache the page after the first visit so it’s okay. That’s why he said static content only.
[/quote]

How often are people going to visit this site? It seems to me that people aren’t going to go to this site everyday.

Also, looks to be a copyright infringement on someone’s part. Two companies with the same name in the same industry.[/quote]

Difference in the writing of the name.

Read full topic

item.title: So i made a site
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“justaguy, post:32, topic:481785”][quote author=m1lkman link=topic=600024.msg4222069#msg4222069 date=1360805327]
Loading everything at once is slow. If it’s a small enough site then I don’t see why not but for the OPs site that has a lot of graphics information it is a bad idea.
[/quote]

Well the browser will cache the page after the first visit so it’s okay. That’s why he said static content only.[/quote]Not only that but if there isn’t a lot of content, you end up saving space since a user would end up going to each page anyway, resulting in more repeated code and HTTP requests.

Read full topic

Also, looks to be a copyright infringement on someone’s part. Two companies with the same name in the same industry.

item.title: So i made a site
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“m1lkman, post:29, topic:481785”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=600024.msg4221584#msg4221584 date=1360788299]

Not a fan of those designs. Too much scrolling involved.

The idea is that you click on the floating nav bar and it takes you to the corresponding section… no scrolling involved
[/quote]

Silly idea to make everything load on one page.[/quote]Why? If it’s something like documentation or just static content I think it makes sense.

Read full topic

item.title: So i made a site
item.dc:creator: @TheAmmoBandit TheAmmoBandit
item.description:
@TheAmmoBandit wrote:

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:22, topic:481785”]So I looked into the code a bit more and I think you should consider using HTML5 and HTML5 tags (, , etc). You should also avoid using IDs in selectors to make your CSS more re-useable. A lot of your code is using inconsistent spacing/tabbing so that’s another thing to work on.

Overall though it’s not bad and I’ve seen a lot worse here.[/quote]

Well uh, thanks i guess?

Read full topic

item.title: So i made a site
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

So I looked into the code a bit more and I think you should consider using HTML5 and HTML5 tags (, , etc). You should also avoid using IDs in selectors to make your CSS more re-useable. A lot of your code is using inconsistent spacing/tabbing so that’s another thing to work on.

Overall though it’s not bad and I’ve seen a lot worse here.

Read full topic

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:19, topic:481785”][quote author=Bellend link=topic=600024.msg4216651#msg4216651 date=1360358574]

Huh, Google Web fonts don’t require html5 capable browsers, can you not use them?

Yeah, but as you can see, the current fonts aint google api fonts
[/quote]Just convert them to IE’s font (EOT or some shit) and include two in the CSS.[/quote]

The EOT Versions are included in the Font-Face

item.title: So i made a site
item.dc:creator: @Bellend Bellend
item.description:
@Bellend wrote:

justaguy:

Never use font images for main content I beg of you… Headers would probably be fine.

it seriously depends on what site your making and who’s going to visit. also im not suggesting that you should do this, im just saying that on this particular case the site would look horrible without the fonts and the only cross web platform fix i can think of it converting it to images.

Read full topic

item.title: So i made a site
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

Never use font images for main content I beg of you… Headers would probably be fine.

Read full topic

item.title: So i made a site
item.dc:creator: @Bellend Bellend
item.description:
@Bellend wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:13, topic:481785”][quote author=Bellend link=topic=600024.msg4216503#msg4216503 date=1360351122]

Two things i would say about this:
#1 looks awfully alot like a template
#2 your code uses html5+ features and not everyone uses html5+
browsers, instead of using custom font files, i would change all the text to images
that way all browsers see the fonts

This isn’t a template.
This was created from scratch. Also changing all the fonts to images would be pretty awfull.
It uses features that all browsers can view and if the browser is html5 compatitable then it will use the included html5 lines.

Why would converting all text to images look awful, it would be identical apart from you cant highlight. also you will find IE8 wont support custom fonts
[/quote]
[size=36pt]apart from you cant highlight[/size]
It is also slower to make them into images, and you have a issue with zooming and browsers like Lynx.[/quote]

Ok, so you have a few minor problems that are fixable, with the font it gets resized to default font and looks terrible. not to mention its not fixable. also the only custom fonts you are using by looking at the images are the headers so no one would need to highlight them.

Read full topic
